commit a31b5b7f4cfe9b2d49f5b538701d398981f82a73
Author: Xavier Claessens <xavier.claessens@collabora.com>
Date:   2016-04-22 13:33:22 -0400

    Change default home_dir to $top_srcdir/build/
    
    This has the advantage of having self-contained cerbero trees which
    is easier to maintain when using multiple cerbero checkouts. Using
    ~/cerbero make it too easy to mess up different builds into the same
    destination.
    
    Note that build/ directory is already in .gitignore.
    
    https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=765436

1	1	cerbero/bootstrap/build_tools.py
8	2	cerbero/config.py

commit a5d6bb96cc364606905a5f65ba88fbcbed813622
Author: Xavier Claessens <xavier.claessens@collabora.com>
Date:   2016-04-21 16:16:37 -0400

    Unset MAKEFLAGS env variable when building makefile recipes
    
    This avoids having user settings messing up our build.
    
    https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=765394

3	0	cerbero/build/build.py

commit 8aef6941fb9a4ff19ea97a6a3dc0e13546a7dfdf
Author: Nicolas Dufresne <nicolas.dufresne@collabora.com>
Date:   2016-04-16 17:17:03 -0400

    soup: Add explicit dependency on glib-networking
    
    This is now being checked in configure script, so it must be built
    before. This is not strictly needed, as we could disable that check, but
    for us it will only make glib-networking be built earlier. This should
    fix recent failure to build on Fedora.

1	1	recipes/libsoup.recipe

commit 49bc3ba9ac57a595040021687716b31f0c09eb06
Author: Martin Kelly <martin@surround.io>
Date:   2016-03-18 16:33:22 -0700

    android: fix NDK r11 extraction bug
    
    The switch to NDK r11 introduced two small bugs during the bootstrap
    process:
    
    - Referencing a tar.bz2 file that does not exist. Fix by referencing the
      correct zip file.
    - Referencing README.TXT, which no longer exists. Fix by referencing a
      file that does exist and should continue to exist in the future
      (ndk-build).
    
    https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=763902

2	2	cerbero/bootstrap/android.py

    commands/run: require an argument

    no-op with no output. However, running "no command" doesn't make much

commit 43c7159d2e2e704b8acd6b002661abc0fcecc380
Author: Martin Kelly <martin@surround.io>
Date:   2015-12-10 16:55:43 -0800

    gstreamer-1.0.mk: fix missing ";" bug
    
    Several command invocations wrapped in for-each are missing ";"
    characters, which meant they get expanded on one line instead of
    separate lines. For some for-each invocations, you can get away with
    this and it will be OK, but for something like host-cp, it changes the
    meaning. As a result, some host-cp invocations will fail with errors
    like:
    
    cp: target ‘X’ is not a directory
    
    Fix this by adding the necessary semicolons.
    
    https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=759380

3	3	data/ndk-build/gstreamer-1.0.mk

commit ec50967d7d540eae5f0d72066d5c2ce1e518c43c

Author: Heinrich Fink <hfink@toolsonair.com>
Date:   2015-11-18 13:15:46 +0100

    glib: Don't store CF run loop to avoid racy cleanup
    
    After polling for file descriptors, the Cocoa select thread did wake up
    the main run loop instance that has been stored in a static variable.
    This variable might have already been set to NULL by
    g_main_context_release, resulting in a segfault of CFRunLoopWakeUp. This
    race is fixed by this commit by simply not storing the main run loop in
    a variable, but instead calling CFRunLoopGetMain locally where needed.
    Within a single process, the main run loop is always the same, and
    always accessible. It is therefore not necessary anyway to remember the
    run loop instance when acquiring the context.
    
    https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=758285

13	21	recipes/glib/0015-Implementation-of-Cocoa-event-loop-integration-in-GM.patch

commit ee6df57b4e80847c58d6c39b05a22afa80a3a6d7
Author: Thibault Saunier <tsaunier@gnome.org>
Date:   2015-11-16 14:39:01 +0100

    Update Gtk, pango, gobject-introspection and pygobject to latest releases

commit 41d1dfcfc89e96f1f7c14319a889e55c5fa14ca2
Author: Alex Dizengof <alex@ireporty.com>
Date:   2015-11-07 18:09:34 +0200

    android: Add SONAME to libgstreamer_android.so for compatibility with Android >= 6.0
    
    Due to the latest changes in Android 6.0 runtime (http://developer.android.com/intl/ko/about/versions/marshmallow/android-6.0-changes.html#behavior-runtime)
    Each module should explicitly define it's SONAME. since the building scripts for building android_gstreamer.so doesn't define soname the library is built without one.
    This will cause a failure in loading any library that uses libgstreamer_android.so.
    
    https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=757732

1	1	data/ndk-build/gstreamer-1.0.mk

    cerbero: add support for multiple config file arguments

    file, the configured target/arch in another and setting the build-tools sources
    directory in another.

commit 81b0319b5a05cbd60899ff0a708de9b1a69a7541

commit 49f591d52618a59ffee0a1b7a78ab7606fd3fd0f
Author: Sebastian Dröge <sebastian@centricular.com>
Date:   2015-11-02 19:32:19 +0200

    gmp: Ship different gmp.h per architecture for universal builds
    
    gmp.h contains the sizeof(mp_limb_t), which is 32 bits on 32 bit architectures
    and 64 bit on 64 bit architectures. nettle will fail with assertions when
    mixing these, and other things probably won't work well either.

commit c5020a56a003891922c0c70d467981768b0fcd16
Author: Heinrich Fink <hfink@toolsonair.com>
Date:   2015-10-30 11:22:29 +0100

    Use xcodebuild to get 'latest' SDK path on OSX
    
    By default, we are now always using the 'latest' SDK, as returned by the
    xcodebuild command line tool, i.e. no hard-coded SDK paths are used by
    cerbero anymore. It is still possible to ask for a specific SDK version,
    by setting 'osx_target_sdk_version' in config (e.g. setting it to
    '10.10' to force compilation against the 10.10 SDK). Requesting an SDK
    version via osx_target_sdk_version that doesn't exist on the system will
    error out.
    
    Fixes https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=757357

19	15	config/darwin.config

commit 54266064743fcc4ea785eae59c9bb8e4aa2400e2

commit 7822f7e84d72d19c903308f150dccc1e6124814d
Author: George Kiagiadakis <george.kiagiadakis@collabora.com>
Date:   2015-10-27 18:33:15 +0100

    spandsp: patch spandsp's Makefile.am to reliably generate some headers with recent autotools

2	1	recipes/spandsp.recipe
35	0	recipes/spandsp/0003-Use-BUILT_SOURCES-to-generate-extra-headers.patch

commit 896b3fcfe101bd84a3cbf04b46022cc7f8c1c879
Author: George Kiagiadakis <george.kiagiadakis@collabora.com>
Date:   2015-10-26 18:38:38 +0100

    spandsp: fix dllexport/dllimport usage on windows
    
    LIBSPANDSP_EXPORTS must only be defined while building libspandsp,
    otherwise code that uses spandsp symbols will be using them with
    the dllexport attribute and the binaries will probably fail at runtime.
    
    The change in config_sh is required because we patch the Makefile.am,
    so automake needs to run again, and while "make" will detect that,
    the code in the tarball is configured to run "automake-1.13", which
    will fail on most systems nowadays. Calling autogen.sh again ensures
    that we call the correct automake.

3	1	recipes/spandsp.recipe
3	17	recipes/spandsp/0001-Fix-build-for-windows-using-mingw.patch
25	0	recipes/spandsp/0002-Define-LIBSPANDSP_EXPORTS-when-building-the-spandsp-.patch

commit 6e30bd3655144b61eecdbf8416d68b504485fc5d
Author: Nicolas Dufresne <nicolas.dufresne@collabora.com>
Date:   2015-09-11 15:19:07 -0400

    Include sysroot value when building pkg-config env
    
    The problem was that when cross-compiling and in need to link against
    system library, we would pick .pc files from the host rather then from
    the sysroot.
    
    This patch simply prepent the sysroot configuration (if set) so .pc file
    is now picked from the sysroot when needed (and allowed).
    
    https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=754902

10	4	cerbero/utils/__init__.py

commit 32200e117d35f15e4012c5142ec5b1533c5a3f30
Author: Justin Kim <justin.kim@collabora.com>
Date:   2015-09-16 00:27:35 +0900

commit f7f78d497eef9c658c321feea83a38dd5f4557e3
Author: Matthew Waters <matthew@centricular.com>
Date:   2015-09-11 22:17:21 +1000

    recipes: don't build libiconv on OSX/iOS
    
    - It's provided by the relevant SDK's already
    - cerbero builds a more recent version of libiconv that has a
      different major version according to the dylib versioning scheme.
    - linking with another library or framework that depends on the
      provided libiconv (e.g. Qt) will fail due to a version mismatch.
    
    https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=754881

2	3	packages/base-system-1.0.package
1	1	recipes/build-tools/gettext-tools.recipe
0	2	recipes/gettext.recipe
1	1	recipes/libiconv.recipe
3	1	recipes/nettle/nettle.recipe

commit c5d237e9d0347ae48b8517b1cd12d648c3d87c85
Author: Nicolas Dufresne <nicolas.dufresne@collabora.com>
Date:   2015-08-14 18:44:52 +0200

    gst-android: ld.gold is now available for ARM64
    
    In the latest NDK ld.gold is now available, so enable it. Also, ld.mcld was not
    usable as the "fix" parameters are expected to be "-fix-cortex..." for this linker,
    while it's harcoded as "--fix-cortex..." in the GCC build. This fixex linking
    Android application for ARM64.

1	5	data/ndk-build/gstreamer-1.0.mk

commit 6f1680681a208444330c31eca3abeec8b850ead0
Author: Nicolas Dufresne <nicolas.dufresne@collabora.com>

commit c5b9b8be6306e75390899d09030101f55c4681a2
Author: Sebastian Dröge <sebastian@centricular.com>
Date:   2015-08-14 13:44:57 +0200

    libiconv: Only rename locale_charset() for libiconv, not libcharset
    
    If we rename it for both, both will still conflict with each other.
    locale_charset() is public API of libcharset but not libiconv, so rename it
    for libiconv.
    
    https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=749423

2	2	recipes/libiconv.recipe
29	0	recipes/libiconv/0004-lib-Only-rename-locale_charset-for-libiconv-not-libc.patch

commit 4e6451099624febe6960e4551887ec25142b0bc2
Author: Nicolas Dufresne <nicolas.dufresne@collabora.com>
Date:   2015-08-04 16:45:53 -0400

    windows: Don't append cross toolchain as host compiler
    
    When cross-compiling for Windows, don't append 'gcc' to the PATH unless
    we are running Windows platform. The appended 'gcc' is not a valid host
    compiler and prevents building packages that need to compile generators
    for the host platform (e.g. freetype).
    
    https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=745804

4	3	config/windows.config

commit a51c825241d32ab74aab980447561cf399399b9d
Author: Philippe Renon <philippe_renon@yahoo.fr>
Date:   2015-08-03 18:47:33 +0300

    https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=745804

    from external repositories.

commit f19bdbab5371ebbdd873d64da989520c6966d2ee
Author: Sebastian Dröge <sebastian@centricular.com>

4	2	recipes/libvpx.recipe

commit b0c1e074f45544c0e36f2e01dc61ab8e559ba72f
Author: Sebastian Dröge <sebastian@centricular.com>
Date:   2015-05-05 09:28:29 +0200

    libvpx: Fix build on Android/x86
    
    Even when passing --target=x86-android-gcc it will build for normal Linux. And
    on Linux some code will use rand(), which does not exist as a symbol on
    Android, and instead is mapped to lrand48() by an inline function.
    
    We have to #define __ANDROID__ to make it do the right thing.

3	1	recipes/libvpx.recipe

commit 20049cfe63221c76524d8f9d8989769e04473ffe
Author: Nirbheek Chauhan <nirbheek@centricular.com>
Date:   2015-04-16 01:17:25 +0530

    packages: Build the list of non-devel files correctly
    
    When no categories are specified for a recipe, the list of non-devel files only
    excludes the variable files_devel. Instead, it should exclude all variables
    ending in _devel to mirror the list of devel files which includes all variables
    that end with _devel. Otherwise, the non-devel package will contain devel files.

1	1	cerbero/build/filesprovider.py

commit 7b107bea8db7767e105ca895771c9bf7915255c7
Author: Edward Hervey <bilboed@bilboed.com>
Date:   2015-04-06 09:04:45 +0200

    cerbero: Properly specify aclocal search directories
    
    aclocal needs to know the difference between local and system m4 directories
    otherwise it will pick up the m4 in the wrong order (it should first pick from
    the specified local m4 directories and *then* if not present check in the
    system directories).
    
    We don't need to specify the build ac directory since aclocal already knows
    that.
    
    What we *do* need to specify is our local 'dist' ac directory containing the m4
    of previously compiled packages, and that should be done solely by setting
    the proper ACLOCAL_FLAGS.
    
    If a package fails after this commit, check that ACLOCAL_FLAGS gets properly
    set as the *last* argument of aclocal.
    
    Tip: You can check the include order by looking at autom4te.cache/requests
    
    https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=747393

2	4	cerbero/config.py

commit 30264972df48850bad1f2689522686ba80b5b469

commit 4c34562e05d9b16574a98eeb73b257263f3ed053
Author: Nicolas Dufresne <nicolas.dufresne@collabora.com>
Date:   2015-02-24 16:53:17 -0500

    graphene: Disable SSE2 and GCC Vector on i386
    
    This currently fails to build on all i386 platforms. The SSE2
    implementation isn't selected at run-time and GCC crash when GCC Vector
    are enabled. Disable both ensure at least the code can run across
    i386 processors that may or may not have the SSE2 feature.

4	0	recipes/graphene.recipe

commit 38baab679878e465c10e320ea4c70f3348b671db
Author: Nirbheek Chauhan <nirbheek@centricular.com>
Date:   2015-02-19 00:25:44 +0530

    libvpx: Use only -O1 with llvm/clang
    
    Due to bugs in llvm/clang and/or in libvpx, there is graphical corruption in the
    encoded video at high optimization levels. None of the patches on the upstream
    bug about this completely resolve the issue. Check again when the next release
    is made.
    
    https://code.google.com/p/webm/issues/detail?id=603

6	0	recipes/libvpx.recipe

    config/android: Add support for Android L and ARM64/X86_64

    * Don't use -Wl,-z,nocopyreloc on ARM64/X86_64

      of the header files are there, so some configure setups thinks
      it exists and fail massively)

commit 727bef419472b275c0b5cbdf4d722b9ef9ad53df
Author: Sebastian Dröge <sebastian@centricular.com>
Date:   2015-01-10 16:07:41 +0100

    glib: On OSX, iterate the NSApplication runloop from the default main context too
    
    We had hacks for that in osxvideosink and libgstgl.
    The hack causes deadlocks and other interesting problems and it really
    can only be fixed properly inside GLib. We will include a patch for
    GLib in our builds for now that handles this, and hopefully at some
    point GLib will also merge a proper solution.
    
    A proper solution would first require to refactor the polling in
    GMainContext to only provide a single fd, e.g. via epoll/kqueue
    or a thread like the one added by our patch. Then this single
    fd could be retrieved from the GMainContext and directly integrated
    into a NSRunLoop.
    
    https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=741450
    https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=704374

1	0	recipes/glib.recipe
1078	0	recipes/glib/0015-Implementation-of-Cocoa-event-loop-integration-in-GM.patch
2	1	recipes/gst-plugins-bad-1.0-static.recipe
2	1	recipes/gst-plugins-bad-1.0.recipe
2	1	recipes/gst-plugins-good-1.0-static.recipe
2	1	recipes/gst-plugins-good-1.0.recipe

commit 94e0e3c5fd8a0566d25003fb07b5ba12284cd496
Author: Sebastian Dröge <sebastian@centricular.com>
Date:   2015-01-09 10:37:43 +0100

    glib: Don't use AT_FDCWD on iOS for now
    
    AT_FDCWD is available since XCode 6.1 and cause linking failures
    when linking an application later with older XCode versions
    
    https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=742097

3	2	recipes/glib.recipe
36	0	recipes/glib/0014-Don-t-use-AT_FDCWD-on-iOS-for-now.patch

commit efaa71cfc4c8ce503ac2e0a568e61f93f83dbf6c
Author: Sebastian Dröge <sebastian@centricular.com>
Date:   2014-12-05 15:36:52 +0100

    osx/ios: Don't include the arch path for non-universal builds
    
    We build everything with libdir=lib, not lib/$arch. Things fail
    if we move libraries around because Mach binaries have the complete
    path to the library embedded instead of just the soname.
    
    Also prevents us from creating some dead links...
    
    There was probably a reason for this code originally, but nowadays
    it just breaks. Leave it there but commented out.

5	5	cerbero/packages/osx/bundles.py
5	5	cerbero/packages/osx/packager.py

commit cbb6dae6fad18e968223ae12e95a5ffd2f8f1da4
Author: Nirbheek Chauhan <nirbheek@centricular.com>
Date:   2014-11-04 22:24:40 +0530

    cerbero/packages: Aggregate the files list in packages correctly
    
    Don't override the files included from a previously-specified recipe.
    Instead, append to it.
    
    Technically, you can do the same thing as:
    
      files = ['libsoup:libs', 'libsoup:devel']
    
    By doing:
    
      files = ['libsoup:libs:devel']
    
    But this is undocumented, mostly unused, and there's no reason why the first one
    shouldn't also work.

8	2	cerbero/packages/package.py

commit 958047eeed4a86fbae19850da2b6cdb8c12d5bbc
Author: Nirbheek Chauhan <nirbheek@centricular.com>
Date:   2014-10-29 16:44:48 +0530

    recipes/custom.py: Add support for SourceType.TARBALL in static plugin builds
    
    custom.py was assuming that all recipes using it are of type GIT or GIT_TARBALL.
    This is a hacky attempt (just as hacky as custom.py itself) to make it support
    tarballs as well.
    
    Note that cerbero already has really hacky support for recipe names that don't
    match the tarball unpacked directory name, and that's required to make this work.

18	10	recipes/custom.py

Date:   2014-09-23 19:28:55 +0200

    toolchain: fix build when toolchain env vars are set
    
    mingw-w64-crt and winpthreads must be built with gcc
    bootstraped by gcc-core. Whith CC and friends env
    variables set, it's using system toolchain instead
    of the one built with gcc-core

Date:   2014-09-23 18:15:01 +0200

    toolchain: fix mingw-w32 toolchain build for linux
    
    Set host='' to prevent the linux.config to append
    the host triplet in toolchain env variables. Since
    we are cross-compiling from x86_64, we don't want
    to end up with CC=i686-linux-gnu-gcc

    glib: Don't use issetugid() on Android

    have it anymore, and some versions of the 32 bit ABI neither.

    https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=736351

commit b15ae7b747cb7a21ccf35199d300a91e24252243
Author: Jan Schmidt <jan@centricular.com>
Date:   2014-04-19 02:23:19 +1000

    Add -mincoming-stack-boundary=4 to the libav cflags.
    
    Android doesn't guarantee stack alignment, but libav already
    has compiler directives to force the stack alignment. This frees
    up a register that lets the asm build.
    
    Suggested as a fix by VLC:
      https://mailman.videolan.org/pipermail/vlc-commits/2012-July/015881.html
    
    I've tested as well as I can without actual hardware. SSSE3 seems broken
    on the android emulator, but I think that's the emulator - the other
    accelerations work fine.
    
    Fixes bug #724105

5	0	recipes/gst-libav-1.0-static.recipe
5	0	recipes/gst-libav-1.0.recipe

commit 986eeeb081e44809c530412ca4c254503697174a

    ios/osx clang x86-32bit compiler fails to build PIC code (end up with
    not enough registers).
    
    No longer make PIC code generation mandatory.
    
    https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=727079

commit cf44849261ec616fb8b10f5a983c7317c5af07f9
Author: Philip Withnall <philip.withnall@collabora.co.uk>
Date:   2014-04-02 12:55:26 +0100

    filesprovider: Add support for non-standard Darwin .dylib filenames
    
    Conventionally, dynamic libraries are named ‘libfoo.[0-9]+.dylib’ on
    Darwin. It is possible, however, for one to be named ‘libfoo.dylib’
    without the library version.
    
    Add support to filesprovider for this non-conventional naming scheme,
    fixing runtime package builds for projects with these non-conventional
    libraries.
    
    https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=727534

15	3	cerbero/build/filesprovider.py

commit c44208bd85965ba1e49dccd41a1e2c62debfcb13
Author: Edward Hervey <edward@collabora.com>
Date:   2013-12-18 11:02:22 -0500

    cache files : Store in 'home_dir' and not in hardcoded CONFIG_DIR
    
    Storing them in CONFIG_DIR (hardcoded ~/.cerbero) wasn't consistent.
    
    The files/builds those cache files correspond to are stored in 'home_dir'
    anyway and if you wipe that directory ... the cache files are obsolete also.
    
    Makes sure that the cache files are stored in the right location if
    someone specifies a different home_dir.
    
    Rename the cache file names for better detection also (i.e. ending with ".cache")
    
    NOTE FOR USERS : Since this changes the location of the cache files it won't detect
    your previous ones (in ~/.cerbero). You can move those cache files from ~/.cerbero
    to ~/cerbero and suffix them with ".cache" if you want to avoid rebuilding everything.
    You only need to do this once.
     Ex: ~/.cerbero/build-tools => ~/cerbero/build-tools.cache

1	0	cerbero/bootstrap/build_tools.py
1	1	cerbero/build/cookbook.py
2	3	cerbero/commands/wipe.py
2	2	cerbero/config.py

commit 3367791a4f3448ca30bd5b74ec284816175560ed
Author: Edward Hervey <bilboed@bilboed.com>
Date:   2013-12-04 10:09:38 +0100

    config: Use 'home_dir' for all paths instead of hardcoded "~/cerbero"
    
    Allows using different cerbero checkouts/builds at the same time on the
    same machine (instead of having conflicts everywhere)
    
    The default value for home_dir remains "~/cerbero" so doesn't cause any
    regression for people not specifying the 'home_dir' property

2	2	config/build-tools.cbc

commit 4aaa0203ff815df18155c3c8acc3a0064f41b642
Author: Edward Hervey <edward@collabora.com>
Date:   2013-11-20 17:46:02 +0100

    build: Log step output to individual files
    
    Instead of outputting everything to stdout.
    
    Files are located in ~/cerbero/logs/<platform>-<arch>/<recipe>-<step>.log
    
    When a step fails, the output is dumped on stdout before closing, so
    that users can still debug the issue.
    
    https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=712785

Author: Thiago Santos <thiago.sousa.santos@collabora.com>
Date:   2013-03-25 10:00:43 -0300

    config: ios: workaround linker crash
    
    Apparently the ios linker crashes whenever the ios minimum version
    is the to 6.0. The solution is to set the minversion to 5.2, that doesn't
    exist and should use the next 'real' version, that is 6.0.
    
    Found this solution at: https://bugzilla.xamarin.com/show_bug.cgi?id=6998

commit 609202624cdfa04957afa12eaa298249ebce4788
Author: Thiago Santos <thiago.sousa.santos@collabora.com>
Date:   2013-03-07 12:36:32 -0300

    xcode: fwlib: make static framework generator handle both thin and fat libs
    
    Static library frameworks can be generated with both a fat and a thin
    binary, depends on the arch selected for the build.
    
    In case it is a fat library, extra work is required to split the fat
    small libraries into its thin parts, merge their objects together separately
    and then create a new fat library from the merged thing versions

commit dfefdf62602e10db5f9aea1cc6a493d2383b806f
Author: Thiago Santos <thiago.sousa.santos@collabora.com>
Date:   2013-03-04 13:48:15 -0300

5	0	cerbero/build/recipe.py

commit 61355a4aa6c35f6daa0d139dd44c7db26d70d144
Author: Thiago Santos <thiago.sousa.santos@collabora.com>
Date:   2013-03-06 15:50:11 -0300

    recipes: workaround for recipes that build too fast
    
    Some recipes just copy files around and are performed very fast. This
    confuses the new files listing for universal builds as it relies on
    the timestamps of the new files to select what are the new ones.
    
    When the build is faster than the FS timestamp resolution, old files and
    new files can be mixed together, causing old files to be removed from the
    final prefix destination dir. A case of this is when gst-sdk-shell is built.
    
    This patch prevents this by waiting a little before attempting to install files to
    the prefix, so that the new files have a timestamp difference to the old ones

4	0	cerbero/build/recipe.py

commit d45556a7ea96bdfd7e526058b1df3194e8346783
Author: Thiago Santos <thiago.sousa.santos@collabora.com>
Date:   2013-02-25 12:14:49 -0300

    build-tools: adding cmake recipe to build-tools

2	2	cerbero/bootstrap/build_tools.py
17	0	recipes/build-tools/cmake.recipe

commit 25cb779ed6ab2584956bc01ba440b4b2ad4e8201
Author: Thiago Santos <thiago.sousa.santos@collabora.com>
Date:   2013-02-26 23:13:29 -0300

    osx: packagemaker: look into applications dir for packagemaker
    
    In newer osx versions, the packagemaker might be installed manually
    as it doesn't seem to come bundled with XCode anymore.
    
    In this case, the usual location is for it to be installed at
    the Applications directory. This patch makes the packager search
    for it in the old directory and in Applications

14	2	cerbero/packages/osx/packagemaker.py

commit 89c01b4d8bcfdd0b03777e2b285f97a1f0d42d10
Author: Andoni Morales Alastruey <ylatuya@gmail.com>
Date:   2012-09-10 16:34:06 +0200

    android.config: fix usage of the gold linker
    
    When passed to CFLAGS or LDFLAGS, libtool strips the -fuse-ld=gold
    option in the linker command and gcc doesn't understand libtool's
    -Xcompiler -ffoo or -Wc,-ffoo. When this option is in CC the option
    remains there.

4	2	config/android.config

commit 917cc90028ecf7de49f08e224d0f7b7dfd1e0fc5
Author: Andoni Morales Alastruey <ylatuya@gmail.com>
Date:   2012-09-06 15:39:22 +0200

7	0	recipes/nettle.recipe

commit 9bdbb2f06ac9b9f4df1ec877b89601ac056dc8c3
Author: Andoni Morales Alastruey <ylatuya@gmail.com>
Date:   2012-09-06 15:35:38 +0200

    gstreamer.mk: fix undefined symbols linkind libxml2
    
    libxml2.la doesn't add any dependency in libz.la, so
    libtool doesn't use the correct link order.
    --start-group --end-group can't be used there to resolve
    the undefined sumbols, because libtool putis libraries at
    the end, and in theory it should resolve deps properly.
    But even adding libz.la as dep to libxml2.la doesn't fix the situation,
    so we end up linking to -lz at the very end of the link chain.

11	6	data/ndk-build/gstreamer.mk

commit ee6a969be9eb4d76bc4ee324488d2c888a61baa4

    with the final prefix where the libraries will be finally installed.

    scanner or gio modules paths

commit f02ba88509436aeadaba7a8bad7a2d380e5415f2
Author: Thiago Santos <thiago.sousa.santos@collabora.com>
Date:   2012-06-29 13:27:29 -0300

    osx-universal: towards universal builds for osx
    
    Adds the UniversalRecipe, an object that has multiple archs recipes
    internally and mimics the Recipe's methods so it can be used as a single
    recipe. Its build steps are implemented as iterating through its inner recipes
    and executing their build steps. The universal binaries generation happen
    on the post_install step, after each recipe has executed its own, the
    UniversalRecipe invokes the osxuniversalgenerator to parse their resulting
    dirs and create the final dir

123	18	cerbero/build/cookbook.py
1	0	cerbero/build/oven.py
13	1	cerbero/config.py

Date:   2012-06-21 11:21:09 +0200

    packages: extend metapackages with 2 new types SDK and Installer packages
    
    MetaPackages were used to create installer packages, but exclusively
    focused to make an installer for the SDK. We need a more lightweight
    packages that doesn't touch the registry on windows or try to create
    a Framework bundle on OS X for packages that only want to extend the
    SDK installation.

4	2	cerbero/packages/packagesstore.py

    defining a bustom base class for recipes. The cookbook will try
    to load the custom.py file in the recipes dirs, which will be made
    available in recipes in the 'custom' module

commit 58ac1cba5fe8902f5bc7daf924207e57b61fcb39
Author: Andoni Morales Alastruey <ylatuya@gmail.com>
Date:   2012-05-21 02:24:39 +0200

    darwin.config: don't add sdk include path but instead link GL headers
    
    We only need GL headers from $SDK_ROOT/X11/Include and including the whole
    path can cause problems in Leopard, where fontconfig headers are in this path
    and its version is too old

commit ad4c37ca39bea4c00de397f8af5eb3708c3d6f6a
Author: Andoni Morales Alastruey <ylatuya@gmail.com>
Date:   2012-03-01 15:13:47 +0100

    gpm: fix libtool detection of linker with --with-cxx
    
    When cxx is not enabled, in configure $GXX becomes GXX="" and later on
    GCC becomes GCC=$GXX. After that there is check for the linker type,
    which fall backs to native MSVC linker when $GCC!='yes', which ends-up
    in libtool's post intall commands for dll's are wrong.'
